授業目的:
The objective of this course is for the student to understand both the theory of corporate finance and its practical applications. We will discuss how financial managers face two decisions- which real assets the firm should invest in and how to raise the cash to pay for them. Thus, the investment decision typically precedes the financial decision. This course will be devoted to different aspects of the investment decision. The first topic is how to value real and financial assets. The second topic is the link between the risk and value, and the third is the management of the capital investment process.
Along with the discussion on corporate asset, capital acquisitions and management, the course also deals with the issues related to agency problems and managerial incentives which might affect the value of a firm. This course will be facilitated by lectures, case discussions and exercises.
到達目標: Students will understand the theory of corporate finance and its practical applications to financial problems at companies.  Students will be able to discuss how financial managers face two decisions- which real assets the firm should invest in and how to raise the cash to pay for them.  Students will also be able to value real and financial assets, applying the link between the risk and returns, and to manage the capital investment process.

Then, after the class, the location of the video file will be announced to the students through LUNA.  Also, look at Luna for the presentation materials and assignments.  If the students had difficulties in getting access to Zoom, then it is OK that you see the video later and communicate with the instructor on Luna. Lecture and Case Discussion.
